Description: Typical range for pulsed fiber lasers in industrial cleaning of ceramics like Si3N4 to remove contaminants without thermal damage; starting at 100W for controlled ablation. Max safe ~300-500W to avoid cracking due to low thermal conductivity (~25 W/mK). Source: IPG Photonics fiber laser specs for cleaning applications; academic review in 'Laser Cleaning of Ceramics' (Optics and Lasers in Engineering, 2018).
Near-IR wavelength optimized for Silicon Nitride absorption characteristics
Beam spot diameter for precise cleaning resolution
Optimal repetition rate for efficient cleaning with thermal management
Nanosecond pulse duration for controlled ablation of contaminants
Optimal scanning speed for uniform cleaning coverage
Recommended number of passes for complete contaminant removal
Optimal beam overlap for uniform cleaning pattern
